prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: Band3
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: Continuum and CO(1-0) sepctral line observations in band 3 of PMNJ1603-4904

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: - Angular resolution set to highest resolution possible for band 3, which is comparable to the ATCA observation - Peak flux density for continuum was estimated based on extrapolating the measured ATCA spectrum between 5 and 40 GHz (spectral index -0.4, total flux density at 40 GHz is 500mJy) - Line width is estimated from CO(1-0) measurments at high and low redshift galaxies (see reference in Scientific Justification) - Peak line flux density was estimated as 10% of expected total flux density in band 3 - Baseband 1 is configured for line observation of CO(1-0) with broadest available bandwidth and reasonable resolution to resolve the line - Baseband 2 to 4 are configured for continuum observations with maximal achievable bandwidth to increase sensitivity and minimal observation time - continuum and spectral line sensitivity set to 1mJy to ensure high SNR even under realistic conditions - Bandwidth used for sensitivity set to assure to resolve the CO(1-0) line

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: Band4
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: Settings for continuum observations in band 4 of PMNJ1603-4904

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: - Angular resolution set to highest resolution possible for band 3, which is comparable to the ATCA observation and required for comparison of flux density measurments in SED - Peak flux density for continuum was estimated based on extrapolating the measured ATCA spectrum between 5 and 40 GHz (spectral index -0.4, total flux density at 40 GHz is 500mJy) - Sky frequncy is set to the recommended value of the OT - Baseband 1 to 4 are taken automatically of OT - full 7.5GHz bandwidth will ensure highest sensitivity and minimal observation time - continuum sensitivity set to 1mJy to ensure high SNR even under realistic conditions

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: Band6
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: Settings for continuum observations in band 6 of PMNJ1603-4904

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: - Angular resolution set to highest resolution possible for band 3, which is comparable to the ATCA observation and required for comparison of flux density measurments in SED - Peak flux density for continuum was estimated based on extrapolating the measured ATCA spectrum between 5 and 40 GHz (spectral index -0.4, total flux density at 40 GHz is 500mJy) - Sky frequncy is set to the recommended value of the OT - Baseband 1 to 4 are taken automatically of OT - full 7.5GHz bandwidth will ensure highest sensitivity and minimal observation time - continuum sensitivity set to 1mJy to ensure high SNR even under realistic conditions

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: Band7
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: Continuum and CO(3-2) sepctral line observations in band 3 of PMNJ1603-4904

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: - Angular resolution set to highest resolution possible for band 3, which is comparable to the ATCA observation - Peak flux density for continuum was estimated based on extrapolating the measured ATCA spectrum between 5 and 40 GHz (spectral index -0.4, total flux density at 40 GHz is 500mJy) - Line width is estimated from CO(3-2) measurments at high and low redshift galaxies (see reference in Scientific Justification) - Peak line flux density was estimated as 10% of expected total flux density in band 7 - Baseband 1 is configured for line observation of CO(3-2) with broadest available bandwidth and reasonable resolution to resolve the line - Baseband 2 to 4 are configured for continuum observations with maximal achievable bandwidth to increase sensitivity and minimal observation time - continuum and spectral line sensitivity set to 1mJy to ensure high SNR even under realistic conditions - Bandwidth used for sensitivity set to assure to resolve the CO(3-2) line

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: Settings for continuum observations in band 9 of PMNJ1603-4904

prp:ObsProposal.prp:abstract: We propose ALMA observations of the gamma-ray emitting young radio galaxy candidate PMN J16034904 in all bands (B3 to B9, continuum) in order to 1.) constrain the position and the shape of its broadband spectral energy distribution (SED) in the mm/sub-mm regime. These measurements are crucial for understanding the physical nature of this exceptional object and cannot be addressed by other instruments due to the compactness of the source and its location at declination 49 degrees and its proximity to the Galactic plane. PMN J16034904 is one of the few extragalactic jets associated with a bright Fermi gamma-ray source. Its multiwavelength properties indicate a young radio galaxy with contribution from starburst activity. Thus it plays a key role in investigating the underlying emission mechanism of newly born active galaxies and the eect of jet induced star formation (AGN feedback).
